did.unittitle: John Benjamin Harris papers 1955-1991 and undated
did.physloc: For current information on the location of these materials, please consult the Library's online catalog.
did.abstract: John Benjamin Harris is Professor Emeritus of Management and Marketing at Virginia State University. He pioneered governmental and commercial awareness of African American advertising markets and, in the 1970s, became the Director of the Virginia State Office of Minority Business Enterprise and Special Assistant to the Governor for Minority Enterprise. The John Benjamin Harris Papers span the years 1955-1991 and include scholarly articles, corporate reports and proposals, product labels, 16mm film reels, and audio tapes. Materials represent Harris' academic and professional work at New York University and Virginia State University as well as his work for the Virginia State Office of Minority Business Enterprise. Topics touched on in the collection include minority business enterprises; minority markets and minorities (especially African Americans) as consumers; and African American mass media. In addition, the collection reflects Harris' work for the advertising industry with employers including Cunningham & Walsh, Inc., the Leo Burnett Company, Inc., and the Ted Bates Company. Brands represented include Alka-Seltzer (Miles Laboratories), Campbell Soup, Coca-Cola, Cleveland Electric, Eastman Kodak, Pillsbury, and Schlitz.

accessrestrict.head: Access Restrictions
accessrestrict.p: However, original audiovisual materials are closed to patron use. Use copies are available in the collections.
Researchers must register and agree to copyright and privacy laws before using this collection.
All or portions of this collection may be housed off-site in Duke University's Library Service Center. The library may require up to 48 hours to retrieve these materials for research use.
Please contact Research Services staff before visiting the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library to use this collection.

userestrict.head: Copyright Notice
userestrict.p: The copyright interests in this collection have not been transferred to Duke University. For more information, consult the copyright section of the Regulations and Procedures of the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library.

prefercite.head: Preferred Citation
prefercite.p: The John Benjamin Harris Papers, David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library, Duke University.

acqinfo.head: Provenance
acqinfo.p: The John Benjamin Harris Papers were received by the David M. Rubenstein Rare Book & Manuscript Library as a gift in 2005.

processinfo.head: Processing Information
processinfo.p: Encoded by Stacy Lavin and Richard Collier
Accession 2005-0101 is described in this finding aid.

scopecontent.head: Collection Overview
scopecontent.p: The John Benjamin Harris Papers span the years 1955-1991 and include scholarly articles, corporate reports and proposals, product labels, 16mm film reels, and audio tapes. Materials represent Harris' academic and professional work at New York University and Virginia State University as well as his work for the Virginia State Office of Minority Business Enterprise. Topics touched on in the collection include minority business enterprises; minority markets and minorities (especially African Americans) as consumers; and African American mass media. In addition, the collection reflects Harris' work for the advertising industry with employers including Cunningham & Walsh, Inc., the Leo Burnett Company, Inc., and the Ted Bates Company. Brands represented include Alka-Seltzer (Miles Laboratories), Campbell Soup, Coca-cola, Cleveland Electric, Eastman Kodak, Pillsbury, and Schlitz.

The collection is organized into three series: Writings, Package Labels, and Audiovisual Materials. The Writings Series includes scholarly articles, reports, and proposals from Harris' academic and professional career in marketing research. The Package Labels series includes images of Campbell Soup Company branded product labels. The Audiovisual Materials series includes reels of television and radio advertisements for various company brands and advertising agencies.

relatedmaterial.head: Related Material
relatedmaterial.p: Other materials relating to this collection may be found in the following Hartman Center collections within the J. Walter Thompson Company Archives: the Domestic Advertisements Collection; the Granger Tripp Papers; the Shirley F. Woodell Papers; the Marketing Vertical File; and the Edward G. Wilson Papers. Also, related materials may be found in the Bates Worldwide, Inc. Records, the John E. Brennan Outdoor Advertising Survey Reports; the D'Arcy Masius Benton & Bowles Archives; the Wayne P. Ellis Collection of Kodakiana; the Kensinger Jones Papers; and the Gene Frederico Papers.

did.unittitle: Writings Series, 1955-1991 and undated

scopecontent.p: Contains manuscripts of academic papers, business proposals, and reports written by Harris. Arranged alphabetically by title.

did.unittitle: Audiovisual Materials 1969-1982 and undated

scopecontent.p: Contains sound tapes and film reels of TV and radio advertisements for Jack Tinker and Partners Advertising Agency (Alka Seltzer), Jos. Schlitz Brewing Co. (Old Milwaukee Beer), The Coca-Cola Company, The Ted Bates Company, Cunningham & Walsh, Inc. (Old Milwaukee).

accessrestrict.p: Restrictions on Access: Originals are closed to researchers. Use Copies are available in the collection.
